solution_line_template: Marvin sold {marvin_bars} candy bars at ${price_per_bar} each so {marvin_bars} * {price_per_bar} = $<<{marvin_bars}*{price_per_bar}={marvin_money}>>{marvin_money} worth of candy
Tina sold three times the amount of candy so ${marvin_money} * {tina_times_marvin} = $<<{marvin_money}*{tina_times_marvin}={tina_money}>>{tina_money} worth of candy
If Tina sold ${tina_money} worth of candy and Marvin sold ${marvin_money} in candy then {tina_money} - {marvin_money} = $<<{tina_money}-{marvin_money}={difference}>>{difference} more sold than Marvin
